alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Tippecanoe; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 12:57PM EST until February 02 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers and locations in Indiana...Illinois... White River at Petersburg. Wabash River at Clinton, Terre Haute, Riverton, Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site, Covington, Montezuma, and Lafayette. .Lowland flooding continues along much of the Wabash River, from Lafayette down to Riverton. There is potential for flooding to develop later in the week at Vincennes and Mount Carmel. The crest is past Lafayette and should reach Covington by mid-morning Monday. The river is rising at all locations downstream. Flooding may last as long as Tuesday, February 6. Lowland flooding is either expected to develop, or may develop, on the lower White River by Monday night from about Edwardsport downstream to the Hazleton area. Flooding could last as long as Wednesday afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Lafayette. * WHEN...Until late Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Lowland flooding in progress. Flood waters close SR 225 just south of the Wabash River near Battleground. Walking and bike trails in Tapawingo Park area are flooded. Warren CR 350 N in the Black Rock Preserve area flooded. Flood waters near Tippecanoe CR 950 W south of CR 75 S. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM EST Sunday the stage was 16.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM EST Sunday was 17.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late Thursday evening and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 200 PM EST /100 PM CST/.
